definitions.text: the sensation that results when taste buds in the tongue and throat convey information about the chemical composition of a soluble stimulus
examples: the candy left him with a bad taste
the melon had a delicious taste
my own preference is for good literature
the Irish have a penchant for blarney
arrogance and lack of taste contributed to his rapid success
to ask at that particular time was the ultimate in bad taste
he got a taste of life on the wild side
she enjoyed her brief taste of independence

definitions.text: a small amount eaten or drunk
the faculty of distinguishing sweet, sour, bitter, and salty properties in the mouth
examples: his cold deprived him of his sense of taste

definitions.text: a kind of sensing; distinguishing substances by means of the taste buds
perceive by the sense of taste
have a distinctive or characteristic taste

examples: The ex-slave tasted freedom shortly before she died
